projects.name: Leetburns
projects.description: A full-stack retro designed leetcode roasting web application, takes leetcode username as input
features: Submit your LeetCode profile and receive instant reponse on your leetcode stats
Rate Limiter, ensuring fair usage with a limit of 3 feedback requests per 24 hours.
Utilizes UUIDs for a secure and personalized experience.
Incorporating modern UI components for a smooth and engaging user experience.

projects.name: Promptify
projects.description: This is a wide platform through which user can create, share, & discover prompts to make their AI tool journey easy and robust.
features: Easily login or create account using your Google account.
User can search prompts through the tags, user, email or even by typing some words of the prompt.
Anyone can view, copy and use all the prompts available on the feed.
Everyone can see what all prompts are created by a respective creator.
After login, users can create and share their amazing prompts.
Easy editing of the prompts after creation.
Users can use OpenAI's GPT-3.5 Turbo on the go via Playground feature
Promptify is fully responsive, accessible through all the devices.

projects.name: Nobel App
projects.description: The 'Nobel App' retrieves data about all Nobel Prize winners together with year, category and laureates' names from the Nobel Prize API
features: Load More Rows: This will not load all the data at once, only 10 rows at once will load and we can load more rows through Load More Rows Button
Fully Mobile Responsive.
>1 Button in Mobile View: This will showcase the people who have won Nobel Prize more than once.
Minimal UI for better User Experience. UI inspiration: https://flipr.ai/
Handled the missing values through logic, e.g.: There were many Laureates with only First name and no Surname. It was showing undefined on the app so handled it via ternary operators.
Implemented all the basic UI elements such as Navbar, Hero Section, Footer, Modal, etc.

projects.name: Summify
projects.description: Summify is a cutting-edge web application created to make it easier to quickly absorb lengthy articles and gain insightful knowledge.
features: Users can summarize articles through it's URL
All the summarized articles get saved in the browser's memory

features: Feature 1
